What you need to know about your ideal client
05 Nov 2019, 22:00 by Anna Vishnevskaya
Hobbies and fears, daily routine and speech style of your target audience - all this must be known in order to give the client exactly what he needs at the right time. And of course, increase sales.



Anna Vishnevskaya Co-founder of the consulting company Marketing Freedom, former head of the marketing department of Symantec in Russia and the CIS.
Why do some manage to reach out to the client, but most do not? The secret is one: the former have studied their client well, and the latter have decided that they or their product is too good to focus on any one thing, so they decided to sell it all at once.
Internally, it‚Äôs very difficult for us to tune in to the installation ‚ÄúFind your ideal customer to sell more efficiently‚Äù, because it contradicts the usual logic: ‚ÄúIf you want to catch more fish, take a bigger net‚Äù.
But in some situations, the usual logic does not work: remember, for example, the rule that the car is pulled out of the skid is ‚Äústeering to the side of the skid,‚Äù and not vice versa, as it seems to us correct. So in the search for customers: you need to clearly know who you are selling to, and not try to reach everyone.
The recipe for successful marketing is simple - know your customer, and start by drawing up his portrait. In this case, you should describe his day, what publications he reads, how he spends his free time, what disturbs him, and so on. But often an important point is omitted, understandable to marketers, but not to people just starting to do business: and for what, in fact, do we need such details?
Let's figure out what you need to know about your client and why that's all.
Socio-demographic portrait
Gender, age, income, industry, location of the client will determine the positioning of your product, as well as significantly affect your price offer. If your client earns about 40 thousand per month, it is unlikely that he will easily buy a consultation for 10 thousand per hour.
Interests
What books and media he reads, in which communities he is a member, where and with whom he spends his free time, what hobbies he has - all this will determine where to look for your client. Namely, the channels for promoting your product and possible partnerships.
For example, one repair company found that its customers often listen to the radio on their way to work. Based on these data, they launched an advertising campaign on the radio, which brought them a lot of applications and cost quite cheaply. And it would seem, well, who is currently listening to the radio?
Typical day
When he gets up, what he does in the morning, how he gets to work, where he spends the evening, this will determine your communication strategy with the client: when to write, what to write, in which social networks and at what time.
The eternal question of everyone who begins to advance in social networks is when to post publications. You will not ask it if you find out when your client logs into social networks.
One of our clients has a space organization business. She sends letters to her subscribers on Sunday morning, because she knows for sure that it is at this time that they like to view mail.
Problems and Fears
What he is worried about, how he wants to look in the eyes of others, what he is afraid of (being rejected, condemning) - this will help you shape your uniqueness, as well as understand what objections (something that stops you from buying) that the client may have. So you can remove them in advance.
Many entrepreneurs at the start of a business are worried that they are pouring money on advertising that does not bring results. Knowing this, the advertising agency can say, ‚ÄúWith our help, every ruble spent will bring you customers,‚Äù instead of ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been in the market for 10 years and we know all the advertising technologies.‚Äù
Emotion and Speech
What pleases, as he says about it, his favorite exclamations, words, expressions - all this will determine the style of your messages, their format and content, as well as the visual component, that is, advertising, post design and so on. This can be found both in a personal conversation and by watching your target audience in social networks.
For example, you have developed a program for young mothers, which will help them gain strength, reboot. And if your message starts with the phrase ‚ÄúNo strength and want to run away from everyone?‚Äù, It will attract much more attention than ‚ÄúHelp yourself to relax with the help of our program‚Äù.

Hard work? Do not argue. But it will pay off in full, because now all your advertising messages, posts on social networks or even packaging of goods will cause a reaction ‚ÄúWow! Yes, you read my mind! How did you manage to do this? ‚Äù, But not‚Äú Well, thanks for writing, but I didn‚Äôt learn anything new. ‚Äù
And most importantly, you will never again ask yourself the question ‚ÄúWhere to look for customers?‚Äù. You will definitely know where they live and what they are interested in!
